}} The '1949â50 season' was Colchester United's seventh consecutive full season
in the Southern Football League. The season ended with Colchester finishing 2nd
and being elected to The Football League after only 13 years of existence. They
also won the Southern League Cup for the second time in their history with a 6-4
aggregate win over Bath City.
